title: A despicable formatting bug ruined my parameter population

subideas.content: A DESPICABLE FORMATTING BUG RUINED MY PARAMETER POPULATION. These are the worst kind of errors. They are like spirits, invisible but effectual. I spent hours checking why my code won't write to some parameters.
I checked everything. I debugged, tweaked statements, printed logs, displayed messages, and everything was fine. Everything, except some parameter value population.
"Why is this happening?!!! The code is in place, the data is flowing, transactions are completing, even the values are being printed in logs, but nothing happens in the model" ‚Äì I said to myself.
I even reached out to another developer to ask if they had changed some global setting in the project, but nothing. I‚Äôm so frustrated.
I remembered that some days ago we struggled with an annoying regional formatting issue involving commas and periods in decimal symbol formatting.
When your Windows Decimal Symbol is set to comma, under ‚ÄúTime & Language ‚Üí Language & Region ‚Üí Number‚Äù, your double variables use that symbol as their decimal delimiter.
This is a Windows setting. It‚Äôs outside of the code. Nonetheless, it is impactful for the program because it‚Äôs employed at runtime.

And well, Revit doesn‚Äôt like that. It‚Äôs a picky software. The Revit API silently (and buggily, in my opinion) leaves the parameter value intact instead of changing it. It would be better if it provided a report (even a nasty exception would be better) in these situations.
Thank God I recalled this. It was traumatic. I even decided to write this post to see if it sticks in my mind in case I‚Äôm not able to port my helpers to another project.
So, remember, environmental settings affect your program. Check the context before refactoring, and maybe set a list of runtime considerations that should be accounted for in your applications.
